Yes, other rugby unions also use technology in a similar way to the Welsh Rugby Union. Rugby is a sport that has greatly benefited from advances in technology, and many teams now use tools like video analysis, data tracking devices, and simulation software to improve performance.

For example, the New Zealand Rugby Union is known for its innovative use of technology, using systems that track player movements in training sessions and games, and also allowing coaches and players to review video footage, track their own fitness, and analyze performance data.

The Australian Rugby Union has also embraced technology, particularly in the form of GPS tracking devices, which are worn by players during training and games to monitor their movements and fitness levels. The data can be analyzed by coaches to optimize training regimens and improve player performance.

Other rugby unions, such as the English Rugby Football Union and the South African Rugby Union, also use technology in a similar way, with a range of tools and techniques designed to enhance the performance of their teams.
